text: {"data":{"codelists":[{"annotations":[{"id":"origin","value":"INTEGRATION"},{"id":"isFinal"},{"id":"lastUpdatedAt","value":"2025-03-27T23:38:34.834836Z"}],"id":"CL_APDREO_INDICATOR","name":"Asia and Pacific Regional Economic Outlook (APDREO) Indicator","names":{"en":"Asia and Pacific Regional Economic Outlook (APDREO) Indicator"},"descriptions":{},"version":"5.0.0","agencyID":"IMF.APD","isPartial":false,"codes":[{"annotations":[],"id":"LUR","name":"Unemployment rate","names":{"en":"Unemployment rate"},"description":"The percentage of the labor force that is unemployed and actively seeking employment. It is calculated as the number of unemployed persons divided by the total labor force.","descriptions":{"en":"The percentage of the labor force that is unemployed and actively seeking employment. It is calculated as the number of unemployed persons divided by the total labor force."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"NGDP_R_PPP_PC_PCH","name":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Purchasing power parity (PPP) per capita percent change","names":{"en":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Purchasing power parity (PPP) per capita percent change"},"description":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. Rate of change in the average purchasing power per person in a country over a specific period. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. Rate of change in the average purchasing power per person in a country over a specific period. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"PCPI_PCH","name":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Period average, percent change","names":{"en":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Period average, percent change"},"description":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This calculates the change relative to the average value over the entire period, not just the starting point. This is often used when the data fluctuates significantly within the period, and the average provides a more representative value for comparison. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This calculates the change relative to the average value over the entire period, not just the starting point. This is often used when the data fluctuates significantly within the period, and the average provides a more representative value for comparison. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"NGDP_RPCH","name":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Percent change, Domestic currency","names":{"en":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Percent change, Domestic currency"},"description":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. This measures the relative change in a value over time, expressed as a percentage. It is calculated as the difference between the new value and the old value, divided by the old value, and multiplied by 100. 1 Currency issued by the country of origin, used internally. Used to specify what Unit of Measure the country used to provide data to the IMF. ","descriptions":{"en":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. This measures the relative change in a value over time, expressed as a percentage. It is calculated as the difference between the new value and the old value, divided by the old value, and multiplied by 100. 1 Currency issued by the country of origin, used internally. Used to specify what Unit of Measure the country used to provide data to the IMF. "}},{"annotations":[],"id":"PCPIE_PCH","name":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), End-of-period (EoP), percent change","names":{"en":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), End-of-period (EoP), percent change"},"description":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This focuses on the change between the value at the beginning of a period and the value at the end of that period. The period could be a day, month, quarter, year, etc. This is often used to track changes in financial or economic indicators over specific periods. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This focuses on the change between the value at the beginning of a period and the value at the end of that period. The period could be a day, month, quarter, year, etc. This is often used to track changes in financial or economic indicators over specific periods. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"BCA_GDP_BP6","name":"Current account balance (credit less debit), Percent of GDP in US dollars","names":{"en":"Current account balance (credit less debit), Percent of GDP in US dollars"},"description":"The current account balance is the balance of current transactions (transactions in goods and services, earned income and transfer income) between residents and non-residents. The term current account balance is used in the external accounts and is expressed from the perspective of resident units. The term current external balance is used in the national accounts and is expressed from the perspective of the non-resident units, and therefore with the opposite sign.  Value expressed as a percent of the GDP of a country denominated in US dollars. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"The current account balance is the balance of current transactions (transactions in goods and services, earned income and transfer income) between residents and non-residents. The term current account balance is used in the external accounts and is expressed from the perspective of resident units. The term current external balance is used in the national accounts and is expressed from the perspective of the non-resident units, and therefore with the opposite sign.  Value expressed as a percent of the GDP of a country denominated in US dollars. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GGXCNL_GDP","name":"Net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), General government, Percent of fiscal year GDP","names":{"en":"Net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), General government, Percent of fiscal year GDP"},"description":"Net lending is defined as the difference between changes in net worth due to saving and capital transfers and net acquisitions of non-financial assets (acquisitions less disposals of non-financial assets, less depreciation). If the amount is negative, it represents net borrowing. In the external accounts, it represents the sum of the balances on the current and capital accounts. This is conceptually  equal to the net balance of the financial account. If the balance is positive, it is called net lending, implying that in net terms, the economy supplies funds to the rest of the world. If the balance is negative, it is called net borrowing, implying that in net terms, the economy receives funds from the rest of the world.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country during its fiscal year, defined as the specific 12-month period a government uses for its budgeting and accounting purposes. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Net lending is defined as the difference between changes in net worth due to saving and capital transfers and net acquisitions of non-financial assets (acquisitions less disposals of non-financial assets, less depreciation). If the amount is negative, it represents net borrowing. In the external accounts, it represents the sum of the balances on the current and capital accounts. This is conceptually  equal to the net balance of the financial account. If the balance is positive, it is called net lending, implying that in net terms, the economy supplies funds to the rest of the world. If the balance is negative, it is called net borrowing, implying that in net terms, the economy receives funds from the rest of the world.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country during its fiscal year, defined as the specific 12-month period a government uses for its budgeting and accounting purposes. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}}],"codelistExtensions":[]}]},"meta":{"schema":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sdmx-twg/sdmx-json/master/metadata-message/tools/schemas/2.0.0/sdmx-json-metadata-schema.json","id":"IDREF1270","test":false,"prepared":"2025-11-09T20:55:21.633405045Z","contentLanguages":["en"],"sender":{"id":"unknown"}}}
